tagDescription: to Ld.Glenely. Re His Tenantry in P.E.I.and the circular letter to the Proprietors.
to Andrew Colville & Thomas H.Brooking. Requesting that they bid high in the event of Chancery sale of the Cambridge Estate property mortgaged to them in order to secure same.

and Mr. ? to Saml.Cunard. Referring him to a letter to himself & Geo.R.Young rebusiness of the projected Land Co. Propose giving him option on wither Cambridge or Hill Estate, or assigning both on terms.Request early reply.
Appraisement of Major Rankin's farm by J.Atkinson.Messrs McLeod and Donald Martin.
to Murdoch Buchanan, Requesting him to release certain lands to Major Rankin on account of recent survey by Curtis.
Protest of Bill of John Cullen,Liverpool returned to Messrs. Fairbanks,Dec.20, 1812 following.
to Sir Chas. Fitzroy, Re The interests of the Land Company in P.E.I. Enclosed is Cunard's letter to Colville of 13 Aug, 1838, following.
to Andrew Colville. Re Affairs of the Island and Sir Chas.A.Fitzroy's letter to the Proprietors re-"Escheat".
Applying to be Secretary to the New Prince Edward Island Land Company, about to be formed.
to Messrs. Wm. And Geo.R.Young Reporting on Creditors' suit of Gwyer against Cambridge.
to Colville. Re The cultivation of the land in Prince Edward Island
to Artemas Bambridge giving particulars as to Cambridge property so as to enable sale thereof.(Pencil note of Artemas Cambridge.)
to Andrew Colville. Lots 62& 31 in P.E.I. Their boundaries & extent. Conversation with Govr. of Island re- Escheators Settlers to be sent to Island.

to Lord Glenely. Re The payment of the quit rents of P.E.I.and enclosing letter of Robt.Stewart who encloses copy of one from the Island, giving opinions and feelings existing there. (All in Stewart to Colville P.19268.)
Memo.- re- Accounts of London various Townships in P.E.I. Dec.31 1854.
?.....to Wm.Johnston. His neglect in transacting of Lord Selkirk's business in P.E.I.

to Andrew Colville. Replys to favor of Oct. 1st re-Cambridge Estate and foreclosure of Mr.Cave's mortgage. Sends some Island papers. Refers to Mr. Stewart & Mr. Brooking for further information. Has written Clarke & Medcalfe signifying his own and Cunard's approval of suggestions made.
to Andrew Colville. Re Receipt of Capt. Davis' Documents sent by the Str. Victoria for Registry and Sir Chas.Fitzroy's letter to the Proprietors of land in the Island re"Escheat."
to Major Rankin, ReBoundaries of his farm,and the order given to Durveyor Curtis to correctly establish same.
Copy of John Richardson's letter to Colville, sent to Wm.Johnston re- Suit against Mr.Cambridge for Lot 32 P.E.I. Enclosed in Colville to Johnston of 19th June following.
List of Tenants in Townships Nos. 31. 53,59,60,61,62,57,58, of Lord Selkirk's property.With number of acres each holds,period of lease, annual rent, time of payment and arrears of rent due.
to Wm.Johnston. Still without information from him-re- Lord Sos Affairs at the Island.Encloses Richardson's letter and his own answer re- suit against Cambridge.
report on his Survey and the establishment on boundaries fo Rankin's Farm.
to Colville. Enclosing statement of their account for payment of Rents due the estate of Lord Selkirk in P.E.I.
Sketch for the division or appointment of the Hill & Cambridge Estates;enclosed in above, from Stewart to Colville.
to Mr.Young, Willing to wait on him but desires no further intercourse with Mr.Douse having lost faith in him through repeated breaches of promise.

Deed Poll or Agreement and Articles of Co.-partnership between the H.B.Co. and it's chief Factors and Chief Traders; forming Constitution for 21 years from 1821 to 1842.----------------Settling the manner in which the Capital is formed,accounts are to be stated; securing interests of parties connected,and providing providing for the Government of the Country, and the management of the trade;with-scheme re- appointment of Councillors,Chief Factors & Chief Traders,and number of Clerks and Postmasters required for service of fur-trade; and Notes signed by Geo.Simpson(Sir) Govr.-in-Chief of Ruperts Land and General Superintendent of H.B.Co.Affairs.
to William Johnston. Requests that he render annual account as agreed-and re-Settlement of Mrs Bechan's affair.Mrs Stewart's claim and protested Bill on John Cullen.
to Messrs.Chas.& Saml.Fairbanks. Enclosing Bil of Exchange for Â£61 on Mr.Cullen and protest of same.
to Artemas Cambridge forwards,as his attorney,Leml.Cambridge's letter of July 8 1835,giving particulars of Cambridge Estate. (Pencil note by Artemas Cambridge.)
to Lord Glenely. Re The refusal of Tenants to pay their rents and the circular letter of Sir Chas.Fitzroy.

Extract of letter Wm.McCulloch Royal Navy to E. Irving. Re American Schooners' fishing in Canadians waters and giving prospectus for a Joint Stock Cod,Mackerel and Hering Fishing Co. to be established on the North side of P.E.I.
to Geo.R.Young. Enclosing copy of McKintosh's letter to Capt.Leslie requit rents.- Suggestions re- remedy to prevailing lawless proceedings in the Island.(Enclosed in Stewart to Colvill.P.19268)
Statement of Murdoch Buchanan - re - the inferred encroachment on Major Rankin's farm.
to Mr Young, Re Mr.Cunard's message- nut fully intimated by Hill sends documents by bearer proving that he has been injured.
Statement of Major C.D.Rankin -re- the encroachment made on his farm by the Buchanans.
to Lord Selkirk. Re His efforts to remedy mischief done by Lt-Govr. 's letter to proprietors of P.E.I. land,and projected Land Co. in the Island.
Memo.-re- Wm.Douses' account of rents of Selkirk Estate in P.E.I. Account follows.
to Andrew Colville. Re The re-entry lands in the case of farmers leaving the Island,taking their leases with them and not returning.

to Andrew Colville. Re Barley & Oats sent for sowing on the Island.Opening of roads,the Wiltshire Settlement people and improvement of their Sheep stock. Ld.S's and other Estates in the Island and miscellaneous other subjects.
Extracts from W.W.Irvings letter-re- P.E.I.Affairs
Remarks upon the report of the Joint Committee of the Legislative Council and Assembly of P.E.I. upon the Memorial of the Proprietors against the Land assessment Act,passed in 1837.
to Andrew Colville. Acknowledging letter of 3rd isnt. re- representations of Mr.Douse on Tenantry in P.E.I.
Copy of a letter to Lord Glenely from Colville giving observations on the circular letter of Sir Chas. A. Fitzroy to the Proprietors in P.E.I.
to Andrew Colville. Informing him of the Measures adopted relative to the formation of the Land Co.

Journal of E.R. Enclosing narrative of trip from Jack River to Red River Settlement pae 18741. Journal kept from Fort Douglas to Fort Deer page 18761. Journal from Phoenix Town to Fort Felix. 4th January 1816.page 18777 and Journal of trip from Brandon House to Hunting Tent,Feby 15 1816.page 18784.
Memorial of the Proprietors of Prince Edward Island to Lord Stanley re- The Fishery Reserves on the Coasts of the Island.

to Andrew Colville. Enclosing Sundry Bills by vessel sailing Dec.7. Will send accounts with Estate of Lord Selkirk's and Statement of Public Situation of Island, by a vessel called the "Jesse" sailing in two weeks.
to S.Cunard. Re Payment of his (Cunard's) share of Bond;Cambridge Estates Papers; Employment of an Agent and Collector for Land Co. Suggests Mr.Douse;also Mr. Irvine as a second agent.
to S.Cunard. Re Payment of his(Cunard's) share of Bond;Cambridge Estate papers;Employment of an Agent and Collector, for Lan Co. Suggests Mr. Douse;also Mr. Irvine as a second Agent.
to Messrs.Chas & Saml.Fairbanks. Informing them of death of Lord Selkirk at Pau,France. on 8th of April 1820. Is named as an executor of the Estate.
to Robert Hodgson,Atty of Ld.Selkirk executors. Directing return of execution pluries of the Trustees of Ld S's Execrs. against Major Rankin.
to Andrew Colville, Enclosing copies of his letters to Clarke & Metcalfe, and to Mr.Cook and Bristol,re- the Chancery Sale of the lands on P.E.I. and settlement of his share of purchase from Mr.Cave.
Mr. ? ---to Geo.R.Young. Re Projected Land Co.dissolution of same on account of non-acquiescence to what has already been done.-Warning against Cambridge Mortgages.
to Hon.S.Cunard, Re The failure of Hill to deliver message giving his ( Cunard's ) guarantee that there would be no further trouble in connection with his lands.Mr. Douse's intrigues.
Accounts of Messrs.Fairbanks with Estate of late Lord Selkirk, enclosed in foregoing letter.
to Major Rankin, and others. Enclosing Curtis' report of survey.
Oath of Andrew Colville, executor of Lord Selkirk's Estate. re- the papers sent to Wm.Johnston and bill for Â£40 believed to have been lost at Sea.
Report of Saml.P.Fairbanks. Re His collection of outstanding debts due the Estate of the late Lord Selkirk in P.E.I.

to Lord Glenely, P.E.I. Affairs. The Escheat question,the agitation amongst the Tenantry,the payment of their rents. The outrages at the cross roads near Emany's and on one of lots of Ld. S's property.Requests redress.
to Andrew Colville. Re His office,remittance of Accounts and continuation as Agent to Lord Selkirk.

to A.Colville. Re His letter to Sir Chas.A.Fitzroy and re-the Fisheries of P.E.I. Sorry his letter did not meet approval but feels that defence of Proprietors has done good. Fully adopts his views re-fisheries.Encloses extract of Mr.Douse's letter of Dec. 15 1838 setting forth plans of settlement of several lots;and answer to same.
to Malcolm & John Buchanan, Major Rankin to hold all the land he possesses.No more to  to be givien to them as they already have more than lease than lease calls for.
Bill of Exchange enclosed with protest of same in following letter to Colville to Messrs. Fairbanks.
and Mr.? to Saml.Cunard,& Geo.R.Young. Re Difference arising over the appointment of a Solicitor to the Land Co. in P.E.I.
to Andrew Colville. Enclosing draft of letter to Lord Grey.Hope to have an interview with him in London.
to Major Rankin. Enclosing letter re- the judgment at the Suit of Earl Selkirk;judgement to be discharged on acceptance of terms and return letter.
Journal of J.McNab.Kept at Fort Williard from May 18-Oct 1817.
to Andrew Colville. Re Mr.Douse's letter to Colville & the refusal of the Tenantry of P.E.I. to pay their rents as a result of Sir.Chas.Fitzroy letter to the proprietors.
Heads of an Agreement between Lord Selkirk and the Cascumpic Acadians re- the purchase of Lot 10.
to Andrew Colville. Re His views on P.E.I. Land Co. Reasons for non-appointment of Mr.Young as its Solicitor, and the appointment of Mr. Peters to that office.

to John Leslie of Schooner Pond Miller re- the address to the Lt.Govr. by the Inhabitants of North King's County P.E.I. re- payment of Quit Rents and their subsequent refusal to do so. (Enclosed in Stewart to Colville,P.L9265)

to Geo.R.Young. Enclosing copy of McIntosh's letter to Capt.Leslie- requit rents -- Suggestions re- remedy to prevailing lawless proceedings in the Island.(Enclosed in Stewart to Colville, P.19268. (See above)
List of Bills and papers sent by Johnston to Colville.
to Andrew Colville. Enclosing parcel for Mr.Brooking from Chas.Young and re- Unpleasant reports from the Selkirk Settlement in P.E.I. Sends copy of Major Rankin's papers.
Lord Selkirk's Diary No II from Oct. 7 to November 14 1803. Subjects of which are inserted in the Margins.

to Andrew Colville. Re Cambridge Estate; the delivery of the Title Deeds and other Documents to Mr.Young;capabilities of Mr. Young & Mr. Peters to manage estate; Mr Cunard's wishes as to continuance of himself in positioned the placing of either Young or Peters as clerk against him and he against them; authority given him by Cunard to buy lands for him at sales. Encloses Bill of Exchange for L65 and offers services for any business required, of him.

to Andrew Colville, Re His satisfactory visit to P.E.I. with Mr.Cunard; the Deeds & Leases in Mr.William Douse's possession. Encloses copy of Col.Herald containing his defence,and that of other proprietors who sent in the Memorial to Lord Glenely.Reference made to Hill & Cambridge Estates Sends original letter from Trustees-re- Agreement in the Chancery suit,of the Cambridge Property.
to Andrew Colville. Regrets not having interview with Sir John Hervey re- Tenantry,Whist at Lot 62.Was in conversation with New York.Reports on Lot 62.
to Wm.Douse. Boundary of Major Rankin's farm.
to Andrew Colville, Re The fore at the Grist Mill at Pinnette,P.E.I. Wishes to purchase whole premises. Encloses copy of letter addressed to Geo.Young-re-same.
to Isaac Cook. Enclosed in Young to Colville of Aug. 20 1838.

to Wm.Johnston, Has received communication of 6 Dec.and enclosed bills. The "Jesse" not arrived;fears lost at sea. Requests duplicate of Bill of Exchange for Â£40 and paper of Mr. Stewart re- lands rightfully belonging to Lord Selkirk.
to Andrew Colville. Re Mr.Peters' letter referring to meeting called of Tenants by Mr.Cambridge for purpose of raising Â£10,000 to pay Mr.Cave's demand. The effect if land tax goes into operation.
Journal of Bte Lemonie (In French) kept from June 5 to Oct 7,1818.
to Andrew Colville. Enclosing sketch for the Hill & Cambridge Estates. Refers him to Mr. Saml. Hill for information re-Hill property.

to Andrew Colville, Re Application of Mr. Young for Solicitorship for the Land Co. at the Island, and appointment of Mr.Peters to that position;the settlement of his share of the puchase from Mr.Cave.Encloses letter to Sir.C.Fitzroy, Govr. Of the Island re- the Land Coy's interests there.

to Proprietors of land in P.E.I. residing in England re- American Schooner's fishing in Canadian waters and giving prospectors of a joint Stock Cod,Mackerel and Herring Fishing Co. to be established on the North side of P.E.I.
to Saml. Cunard. Withdraws his property from projected Land.Co. Lord Selkirk also declines embarking his property in the concern. Suggestions re- breaking up the concern and retaining good feeling.
to Messrs.C.&S.Fairbanks, annexing copy of his letter of Dec 7th 1820 enclosing Bill of Exchange,and requesting that amount of Bill wit interest may be remitted.
?... to William Johnston(Duplicate letter) Re Lands in P.E.I. claim of Mrs Stewart,widow of late Chas.Stewart,Agent. Arrangements made for the Amalgamation of the N.W.Co with the H.B.Co.

to Geo.R.Young. Enclosing copy of his account in connection with Cambridge Estate.Visit to Murray Harbor unsatisfactory.Settlers decided not to pay rent until Fishery Reserves and other Matter settled.
to Donald Buchanan, Ejectment to be commenced against him unless his fence is put on correct & proper division line between his own & Major Rankin's property.
to Wm Douse, Requesting that case of Boundaries of his property be settled immediately.

to Lord Selkirk. Delivered to Saml. Murchison,merchant, and James Stewart, Solicitor-general,Nova Scotia, Agents for Ld.Selkirk in the end of October.-re- to the land speculation existing in P.E.I. during his term of office there.
to John Richardson. In answer to his of 18 June,-re- Suit against Cambridge for Lot 32 P.E.I. Enclosed in following letter of Colville to Johnston.
Draft of Letter to Lord Grey from Lord Selkirk- Several Bills passed by the Legislature effecting the land owners of P.E.I.
to Geo.R.Young. Re The Hill & Cambridge Estates and affairs of the P. E. Island Land Co.

to Andrew Colville. Enclosing papers explaining nature of claim made by Messrs?Cambridge for additional land.Has written Mr.Brooking for correspondence between Mr.Cunard and Mr. Young re- Solicitorship.

Extract of a letter from Sir Chas.Fitzroy to Lord Glenely. Calling attention to enclosed copy of letter to Revd.Mr.McLennan,Clergyman of Belfast District,P.E.I. also that Gentlemen's reply-re- Mr.Douse's complaint of not being able to collect rents on Ld.S's property on account of circular letter to the proprietors.

to Rev. J.McLennan. Writesper direction of Lt-Govr. for such information upon Mr.Douse's representations re- the disturbance among the Settlers caused by Sir Chas.Fitroy's circular letter,as may come within his knowledge.
Abstract of  Bibles of Townships in Prince Edward Island with map and Plan. Particulars, -re- Major Rankin's farm formerly Selkirk property in P.E.I. with remarks by Mr.Stewart on his survey of same.
Letter of Irving (unaddressed) Re Presentation of Bond from Bristol,Mr.Brooking's payment of his Â£200l transfer of Mr.Cunard's Â£7,200; payment of a note of L2400 and sale of Browns last 10 hhds(?)
to Andrew Colville. Suggestions re- Better management of Lord Selkirk's Estate in P.E.I.
to S.Cunard. Re Hill and Cambridges Estates; the appointment of Mr. Peters as Solicitor General; the conduct of Sir Chas. Fitzroy, Govr. Of P.E.I. & Tone Mr. Young's letter to the Govr. & Ld Glenely.
to Mr.J.P.Collins. In answer to his enquiring per direction of the Lt-Govr. re- Mr.Douse's representation which he claims to be false.
DEDIMUS PROTESTATEM to Thomas the Earl of Selkirk & Robert Semple,Esq. of Commissions of the Peace.
to Andrew Colville. Re Mr.Cambridge and purchase of Cambridge Property from Mr.Cave.Mr.Hill and Settlement of purchase of Hill Estate property.
to Colville. Enclosing copy of letter to Sir John Harvey with answers.Requests Signature to answer if approved.
to Andrew Colville. Re The circular letter of Sir Chas.Fitzroy,Lt-Govr.of P.E.I. and -re subsequent refusal of Tenants to pay thei rents.
to Andrew Colville. Re The circular letter of Sir Chas.Fitzroy,Lt-Govr.of P.E.I. and re subsequent refusal of Tenants to pay their rents.
to Andrew Colville. Barley & Oats offered will be great assisance.Starts for Lot 62 in few days.

Memo: re- Mr.Cunard & Mr. Young.objectionable points in Mr.Cunard's conduct. Appointment of Mr.Peters to office of Solicitor to the projected P.E.I.Land Co. and the barring of Mr.Young from receiving same.
to Andrew Colville. Enclosing copy of his letter to Young,one from McIntosh to Leslie and one of Young to Ld.Glenely.
Lord Selkirk's Diary No I from 3 Aug-5 Oct 1803. Subjects inserted in Margins.
to Lord Glenely. Enclosing extract of Mr.Douse's letter of 7th Jany,- re- effects of Sir Chas.Fitzroy's circular letter and also a newspaper of 25 Nov re- the conduct of Major Rankin.
